categories: Category:LEGO Star Wars: The Freemaker Adventures

nodes.text: Freemaker Salvage and Repair was a one-minute LEGO promotional video produced in 2016 in conjunction with the Disney XD television series LEGO Star Wars: The Freemaker Adventures. It was released on both the LEGO website and the LEGO Star Wars: The Freemaker Adventures – Complete Season One DVD and Blue-ray collection.

The video opens with a shot of a starfighter battle between the Rebel Alliance and the Galactic Empire before zooming in on the Wheel space station. Flying the family starship StarScavenger, Zander Freemaker welcomes the viewer to Freemaker Salvage and Repair, his family-owned garage and repair business. Rowan Freemaker adds that they specialize in finding the "hard to find" and "re-energizing the obsolete." The Freemakers descend down a ramp into the garage. This is followed by a shot of the B1-series battle droid Roger standing below the StarScavenger.

Kordi Freemaker then asks the viewer to consider why buy new when they can save you credits with quality revitalized galactic salvage. After Roger presses the controls several times, the StarScavenger's cargo hull empties salvage on top of Roger. Zander then shows the viewer a fine Corellian hyperdrive that has a thousand parsecs on it, which he describes as "barely, barley, broken in." Rowan adds that the family business also deals with asteroid damage and blaster scoring to starships. Zander describes Freemaker Salvage and Repair as a full service hangar for speeders, shuttles, fighters, and light cruisers.

Kordi then adds that Freemaker Salvage and Repair is conveniently located on the Middle Ring of the Wheel in the Abrion system. The Freemakers including Roger then chant the slogan: "All Freemakers, the name says it all."
